past simple and past participle of
glorify
to praise and honour God or a person: There are 99 prayer beads - one for each way Allah can be glorified in the Koran. A statue was erected to glorify the country's national heroes.
to describe or represent something in a way that makes it seem better or more important than it really is: I didn't like the way the film glorified war/violence.informal The limousine was really just a glorified taxi.
